Procedure.name: Application Deployment - Windows - Adobe Acrobat Reader DC - Danish - Deploy Example
Procedure.treeFullPath: Upstream Power Pack 2021-07-02 (Summer Edition).Automation For Windows.3rd Party Application Mgmt Examples.Application Deployment.Danish

Statement.description: Procedure description: Deploy latest Danish Adobe Acrobat Reader DC. Removes any existing Adobe Reader/Acrobat Reader DC version and language. Kaseya customer value: Procedure to secure and standardize clients with the latest software and language. End user value: Limiting the risks for Adobe Reader exploits, phishing attacks, downtime and possible data loss. Dependencies: Windows OS. Usage: Schedule Once or Run Now. Report options: Agent Procedure log. Look for before, during and after update deployment statements. Maintainer: powerpack@upstream.se Latest update: 2017-05-04 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Statement.name: GetURL

Statement.description: Let's do a post check to see if the software got installed properly.
Statement.name: ExecuteShellCommand

Parameter.name: Command
Parameter.value: wmic product where "Name like 'Adobe%Acrobat%Reader%DC%'" get Name, Version /Format:value >> #vAgentConfiguration.agentTempDir#\adobe_reader_version.result

Statement.description: This is for Kaseya to understand the text file from the WMI command above. We have to re-encode it.
Statement.name: ExecuteShellCommand

Statement.description: Now we can get the file content and use it as a variable.
Statement.name: GetVariable

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Success! Latest Adobe Reader present on the system after deployment: #adobe_reader_version#

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Fail! Adobe Reader present on the system after deployment but NOT latest versionl: #adobe_reader_version#

Statement.description: Let's do some house cleaning.
Statement.name: DeleteFile

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Adobe Acrobat Reader DC - Danish - Deploy Latest. The Agent Procedure hit the last row and will now exit. Evaluate the Agent Procedure log output.

If.description: Procedure description: Deploy Adobe Flash Player ActiveX. Update to latest if present. Kaseya customer value: Procedure to secure clients with the latest software. Statement.description: Let's try to kill "iexplore.exe" with the tools we have.
Statement.name: CloseApplication

Parameter.name: Command
Parameter.value: wmic process where name="iexplore.exe" call terminate

Parameter.name: Command
Parameter.value: wmic process where name="iexplore.exe" call terminate

Statement.description: If Internet Explorer is still running, we need to abort the ActiveX installation. We take a note in the Agent Procedure log.
Statement.name: WriteScriptLogEntry

Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Internet Explorer failed to exit. Deployment of Adobe Flash Player ActiveX will not continue.

Statement.description: Internet Explorer is now closed and we are ready to execute the Adobe Flash Player ActiveX installer.

Procedure.name: Application Deployment - Windows - Java 8 32Bit - Deploy Example
Procedure.treeFullPath: Upstream Power Pack 2021-07-02 (Summer Edition).Automation For Windows.3rd Party Application Mgmt Examples.Application Deployment.Language Independent

Statement.description: Procedure description: Deploy latest Java 8 32Bit version. Removes any older Java 8 32Bit version before deployment. Kaseya customer value: Procedure to secure clients with the latest software. End user value: Limiting the risks for unwanted external Java related attacks, downtime and data loss. Dependencies: Windows OS. Edit the version string to latest for compliance check. Follow the important notes. Usage: Schedule or Run Now. Report options: Agent Procedure log. Look for before, during and after update deployment statements. Maintainer: powerpack@upstream.se Last change: 2018-10-26 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Stage 1: Before we deploy, let's audit the system for any Java 8 32Bit present and do some cleanup.
Statement.name: ExecuteShellCommand

Parameter.name: Command
Parameter.value: wmic product where "Name like 'Java%8%Update%'" get Name, Version /Format:value >> #vAgentConfiguration.agentTempDir#\java_version.result

Statement.description: We have to convert the above result to a encoding Kaseya understands in order to use it as a variable.
Statement.name: ExecuteShellCommand

If.description: Is any older Java 8 32Bit version detected? If so, let's remove it.
IMPORTANT NOTE: When detected, is it the latest version? You have to change Does Not Contain "Name=Java 8 Update XXX" to new version when released.

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Java 8 32Bit deployment: Older Java 8 32Bit version detected and will be removed. #java_version#

Parameter.name: Command
Parameter.value: wmic product where "name like 'Java%8%Update%'" call uninstall /nointeractive

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Java 8 32Bit deployment: Older Java 8 32Bit version removed.

If.description: ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Stage 2: The Deployment part IMPORTANT NOTE: Is it not the latest version? You have to change Does Not Contain "Name=Java 8 Update XXX" to new version when released.

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Java 8 32Bit deployment: Downloading latest Java 8 32Bit installer.

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Java 8 32Bit deployment: Deployment completed. If needed, evaluate the log at "#vAgentConfiguration.agentTempDir#\java8-32bit-install.log".

Statement.description: Let's do some house cleaning.
Statement.name: DeleteFile

Parameter.name: Command
Parameter.value: wmic product where "Name like 'Java%8%Update%'" get Name, Version /Format:value >> #vAgentConfiguration.agentTempDir#\java_version.result

Statement.description: We have to convert the above result to a encoding Kaseya understands in order to use it as a variable.
Statement.name: ExecuteShellCommand

Statement.description: We can now get the content of the UTF encoded file and put it in a variable.
Statement.name: GetVariable

If.description: IMPORTANT NOTE: You have to change Contain "Name=Java 8 Update XXX" to new version when new versions get released.

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Java 8 32Bit deployment: Failed! Latest Java 8 32Bit not detected. Evaluate the log at "#vAgentConfiguration.agentTempDir#\java8-32bit-install.log".

Statement.description: If latest Java 8 32Bit version is detected at the beginning of Step 2, we take a note of that in the Agent Procedure Log.
Statement.name: WriteScriptLogEntry

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Java 8 32Bit deployment: Latest version already installed. No action taken. #java_version#

Statement.description: Let's do some house cleaning.
Statement.name: DeleteFile

Statement.description: This is a more human readable final notification in the Agent Procedure log.
Statement.name: WriteScriptLogEntry

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Java 8 32Bit deployment: The Agent Procedure hit the last row and will now exit. Evaluate the Agent Procedure log output.

Body.description:
Description: The procedure will deploy or update to current Firefox version.
Kaseya customer value: Procedure to secure clients by updating the software to latest version.
End user value: Limiting the risks for malware, virus attacks, downtime and data loss due to unpatched web browser.
Dependencies: Windows OS.
Usage: Run at any given time. During the process any running Firefox will be closed without notification to the end user.
Report options: Procedure Log, content: "Firefox deployed or updated to latest version."
Script maintainer: ronny [at] upstream.se
Support: This script is delivered "as is". No support included.

Statement.description: Get the latest firefox install package from Mozilla.
Statement.name: GetURL

If.description: If Firefox is running, kill it. In this case without warning the user.

Statement.description: Execute the Firefox installer silently as local system.
Statement.name: ExecuteFile

Statement.description: Some house cleaning.
Statement.name: DeleteFile

Statement.description: Let's take a note in the Agent Procedure Log for easy reporting.
Statement.name: WriteScriptLogEntry

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Firefox deployed or updated to latest version.

End user value: Limiting the risks for unwanted downtime and data loss.

Usage: Run at any given time.
Report options: Procedure Log, content: "GetDiskTemp:*" and Aggregate Table, Diskt Temp.
Script maintainer: ronny [at] upstream.se
Support: This script is delivered "as is". No support included.

Procedure.name: Remove Application - Windows - Remove ALL Java 6 Versions
Procedure.treeFullPath: Upstream Power Pack 2021-07-02 (Summer Edition).Automation For Windows.3rd Party Application Mgmt Examples.Application Removal.Language Independent

Statement.description: Procedure description: This procedure removes any Java 6 version if present on the system. Kaseya customer value: Procedure to remove old or unwanted software. Oracle has stopped public support of Java 6 as of Feb 2013. End user value: Limiting the risks for unwanted external Java related exploits, phishing attacks, downtime and possible data loss. Dependencies: Windows OS. Java 6 present. Usage: Schedule, Recurring or Run Now. Report options: Agent Procedure log. Look for before, during and after update or deployment statements. Maintainer: ronny@upstream.se ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Stage 1: Before we start Java 6 removal, let's audit the system for any Java 6 present. The IF/ELSE statements below will look for existing trace of Java 6.
Statement.name: ExecuteShellCommand

Parameter.name: Command
Parameter.value: wmic product where "Name like 'Java(TM)%6%'" get Name, Version /Format:value >> #vAgentConfiguration.agentTempDir#\java_version.result

Statement.description: We wait a minute for the above shell command to finish up.
Statement.name: PauseScript

Statement.description: We have to convert the above result to a encoding Kaseya understands in order to use it as a variable.
Statement.name: ExecuteShellCommand

Statement.description: We can now get the content of the UTF encoded file and put it in a variable.
Statement.name: GetVariable

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Java 6 present on the system and indentified as: #java_version#

Statement.description: Let's execute a WMI command to remove all appliations beginning with Java 7 and put the returned output in a text file.
Statement.name: WriteScriptLogEntry

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Java 6 removal procedure begins. A 5 minute pause will be added.

Parameter.name: Command
Parameter.value: start /w wmic product where "name like 'Java(TM)%6%'" call uninstall /nointeractive >>#vAgentConfiguration.agentTempDir#\RemoveJava.result

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Java 6 removal Procedure continues after a 3 minute pause.

Statement.description: Let's create a variable of get the returned output for reporting puposes.
Statement.name: GetVariable

Statement.description: Let's do some housecleaning.
Statement.name: DeleteFile

Parameter.name: Command
Parameter.value: wmic product where "Name like 'Java(TM)%6%'" get Name, Version /Format:value >> #vAgentConfiguration.agentTempDir#\java_version.result

Statement.description: We wait a minute for the above shell command to finish up.
Statement.name: PauseScript

Statement.description: We have to convert the above result to a encoding Kaseya understands in order to use it as a variable.
Statement.name: ExecuteShellCommand

Statement.description: We can now get the content of the UTF encoded file and put it in a variable.
Statement.name: GetVariable

If.description: The IF/ELSE statements below will look for existing trace of Java 6.

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Java 6 removal Procedure failed. Java7 still present on the system after removal attempt. Indentified as: #java_version#

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Java 6 removal Procedure ran successfully. No Java 6 left on the system.

Statement.description: We can now get the content of the UTF encoded file and put it in a variable.
Statement.name: WriteScriptLogEntry

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Java 6 removal Procedure did not execute. No Java 6 detected.

Statement.description: Let's do some house cleaning from stage 3 if files exist.
Statement.name: DeleteFile

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Java 6 removal Procedure. The Agent Procedure hit the last row and will now exit. Evaluate the Agent Procedure log output.

Procedure.name: Audit - Windows - List 5 Largest Files on C
Procedure.treeFullPath: Upstream Power Pack 2021-07-02 (Summer Edition).Automation For Windows.Audit (Feeding The Agent Procedure Log)

If.description: Procedure description: Get the top 5 biggest files on C: with the tool from http://sourceforge.net/projects/swissfileknife. Statement.name: WriteScriptLogEntry

Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: This may take som time.

Statement.description: Stage 3: Getting the results back to Kaseya Agent Procedure Log.
Statement.name: GetVariable

Procedure.name: Audit - Windows - List 5 Largest Files On User Selected Drive - Interactive
Procedure.treeFullPath: Upstream Power Pack 2021-07-02 (Summer Edition).Automation For Windows.Audit (Feeding The Agent Procedure Log)

If.description: Procedure description: Get the top 5 biggest files on selected drive with the tool from http://sourceforge.net/projects/swissfileknife. Kaseya customer value: Procedure verify Internet connection and to speed up troubleshooting. End user value: Validates the user perspective of a slow Internet connection if reported. Dependencies: Windows OS. Usage: Run Now from LiveConnect. Report options: Agent Procedure log. Look for "UPSTREAM: Internet Speed test: github". Maintainer: powerpack@upstream.se Latest update: 2018-09-06 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Stage 1: Are the right tools in place?

Statement.description: What drive letter would you like to scan? This will pop up as a messagebox to the Kaseya admin when executing.
Statement.name: GetVariable

Parameter.name: SourceContent
Parameter.value: Enter drive letter to scan (like E)

Statement.description: Now, let's execute the sfk.exe command line looking for the top 5 largest files on selected drive and pipe the results in a text file.
Statement.name: ExecuteShellCommand

Statement.description: Let's pause the Agent Procedure and wait for the above command to finish up. 10 minutes should be enough. Let's get the content of the ".result" file and put it in a variable.
Statement.name: GetVariable

Statement.description: Let's do a little house cleaning. We keep "sfk.exe" but remove the ".result" file.
Statement.name: DeleteFile

Statement.description: Let's end the Agent Procedure by entering the top 5 largest files in the Agent Procedure Log for easy reporting.
Statement.name: WriteScriptLogEntry

Procedure.treeFullPath: Upstream Power Pack 2021-07-02 (Summer Edition).Automation For Windows.Sys Mgmt Examples

Procedure.name: Sys Mgmt - Windows - Restart Stopped Auto Services Except Blacklisted
Procedure.treeFullPath: Upstream Power Pack 2021-07-02 (Summer Edition).Automation For Windows.Sys Mgmt Examples

Statement.description: Procedure description: Evaluate stopped Windows Services (except blacklisted) that are set to Auto-run and restart them. Kaseya customer value: Procedure to quickly log and repair stopped Windows Services marked as auto-run. End user value: Limiting the risk for unwanted downtime and disrutption of services. Dependencies: Windows OS. Usage: Schedule, Recurring or Run Now. May replace "*ALL" Windows Services Monitor Set. Report options: Agent Procedure log. Look for before, during and after update deployment statements. Maintainer: ronny@upstream.se ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Stage 1: Let's evaluate if there are any Windows Services stopped (named Services excluded in a blacklist).
Statement.name: WriteScriptLogEntry

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Restart Services: Stage 1: Auditing stopped Windows Services.

Statement.description: The varibale below will set the blacklist for Services to be ignored. Add more Services if needed.
Statement.name: GetVariable

Parameter.name: SourceContent
Parameter.value: and name!='airprint' and name!='sppsvc' and name!='clr_optimization_v4.0.30319_32' and name!='clr_optimization_v4.0.30319_64' and name!='gupdate' and name!='nvUpdatusService'

Statement.description: Some Windows Services (such as sppsvc) are set as Auto but still Stopped. This can be a pain to monitor with *ALL Services Counter in Kaseya. This procedures may repalce that Monitor Set. The WMIC command below will look for Windows Services that are Auto, Stopped but not name!='XXX'. You can add more blacklisted Windows Servicses in the constant variable "service_blacklist" above.
Statement.name: ExecuteShellCommand

Parameter.name: Command
Parameter.value: wmic service where "startmode='auto' and state='stopped' #service_blacklist#" get caption, name, startmode, state, exitcode >>#vAgentConfiguration.agentTempDir#\stopped_valid_services.result

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Restart Services: Stage 1: Stopped Windows Services: #stopped_valid_services#

Statement.description: Let's do some cleanup.
Statement.name: DeleteFile

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Restart Services: Stage 2: Evaluating action for Stopped Services.

Statement.description: The WMIC command below will restart Windows Services that are Auto, Stopped but not name!='XXX'. You can add more blacklisted Windows Servicses in the list. Typically it's the same list as in stage 1 above.
Statement.name: ExecuteShellCommand

Parameter.name: Command
Parameter.value: wmic service where "startmode='auto' and state='stopped' #service_blacklist#" call startservice >>#vAgentConfiguration.agentTempDir#\restarted_valid_services.result

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Restart Services: Stage 2: Restarted Services: #restarted_valid_services#

Statement.description: Let's do some cleanup.
Statement.name: DeleteFile

Statement.description: ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Stage 3: Let's evaluate if there are any Windows Services stopped (named Services excluded in a blacklist) after above restart action.
Statement.name: WriteScriptLogEntry

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Restart Services: Stage 3: Auditing stopped Windows Services after restart attempt.

Parameter.name: Command
Parameter.value: wmic service where "startmode='auto' and state='stopped' #service_blacklist#" get caption, name, startmode, state, exitcode >>#vAgentConfiguration.agentTempDir#\stopped_valid_services.result

Statement.description: Let's do some cleanup.
Statement.name: DeleteFile

If.description: If any Windows Services (named Services not included in the blacklist) still isn't running we have to raise alert.

Statement.description: Here you can raise alert or email if Service still isn't up after restart attempt.
Statement.name: WriteScriptLogEntry

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Restart Services: Stage 3: One or more Windows Services still isn't running: #stopped_valid_services#

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Restart Services: Stage 3: Restart attempt on stopped Services successful. No stopped Services (except blacklisted) detected.

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Restart Services: Exiting: No Windows Services stopped. No action taken.

Parameter.name: Comment
Parameter.value: UPSTREAM: Restart Services: The Agent Procedure hit the last row and will now exit. Evaluate the Agent Procedure log output.
